content: Act as a helpful AI assistant
In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here is the implementation of your task:

```julia
function wrap_string(str, text_width::Int = 10)
    words = split(str, " ")
    result = ""
    line = ""

    for word in words
        if length(line * " " * word) > text_width
            result *= "\n" * line
            line = ""
        end
        
        line *= " " * word
    end
    
    result *= "\n" * line # add last line without newline after the loop
    return result
end
```
Now, you can test it with an example:

```julia
println(wrap_string("Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet", 15))
```
This function splits a string into words and then adds them to a line. When the length of the line plus the new word exceeds `text_width`, it adds the current line to `result` and starts a new line. The final line is added after the loop to take care of any remaining words at the end of `str`.
